OldSarge

Ladies and gentlemen, never before in our country's history has it been more important to stand up to the enemies of freedom. The very fact that a radio program named Armed American Radio is on the air is a statement to those enemies in and of itself. The fact that we can educate and entertain while vocally pronouncing our God-given right to self defense and our Second Amendment rights on the nation's airwaves is testament to our will and the will of the USCCA to put itself out there. Believe me, I'm out there, really out there ... if there is some government list, I'm on it ... and I'm out there for a reason: Never before has this fight been more important to each and every one of us. Freedom in the United States is at stake--literally--and Armed American Radio is there as the voice of all of us. 
 
 As of this writing, Armed American Radio is now in nine states and cities across the country, with more committed to joining the broadcast weekly. By the time you read this, we will have grown even larger. Please keep checking Armed American Radio for up to the minute information about where you can hear the program in your area as we explode across the country. Remember, keep calling those program directors at your local news/talk stations and ask them to carry Armed American Radio. It works! 
 The Ordinary Guy: Armed American Radio - HUMAN EVENTS
Doc Jones

 Uh Oh, now slim jim will have to take the radios away from his kids emoticon_xgood
Superlite27

Somehow, this just doesn't appeal to me. I don't think it's gonna fly. 
 
 Yeah, I'm actively involved in shooting. I reload, hunt, shoot IDPA, enjoy recreational shooting sports like trap, skeet, and competition. I have also taken numerous self improvement courses such as civilian concealed carry classes (as a requirement for a CCW permit) but then went on to further my knowledge for my own improvement by taking professional advanced carry, low light pistol, close quarters combat pistol, and tactical pistol "operator's" courses.
 
 I am not a NRA member, but seeing how it makes the anti's foam at the mouth, I'm considering joining just out of spite.
 
 I carry my weapon legally at almost every moment of the day. (Except while showering.) If pants are on, so's the pistol.
 
 I enjoy talking about firearms and discussing firearms issues. It is an enjoyable pasttime. That's why I'm here.
 
 Yet, I consider myself an average American. I don't devote my life to guns. I hear the term "gun nut", but it doesn't apply to me because firearms are just a built in part of life for me. 
 
 Are people who take responsibility to maintain their own vehicles by taking a few mechanic's classes, drive their car to work everyday, and possibly have a convertible, or MG in the garage to drive for enjoyment "car nuts"?
 
 Are folks that take gardening classes, grow their own vegetables, and enjoy cooking with their own produce and maybe have a prized Azalea bush and a few flower pots "plant nuts"?
 
 I listen to the local classic rock station. Sometimes I check out American Rifleman, or some other shooting show on the outdoor channel, but I hardly record them or religiously tune in every episode.
 
 If my local radio station did carry Armed American Radio, I might tune in to see if it was interesting, but I already consider myself pro-firearms freedom. Listening would just be preaching to the choir. Why tune in when they might be playing some Pink Floyd on KSHE?
 
 I

simone
Assuredly, a very high state of being constantly afraid.

 Right. Also, if you own a fire extinguisher you are a paranoid wuss living in constant fear of your house burning to the ground.
NATO 556

Assuredly, a very high state of being constantly afraid.

 
 It's not being afraid, it's being aware of your surroundings. Danger is going to exist and be present whether you pay attention to it or not; you should know that fact better than anyone, Simone.
 
 You can be aware of your surroundings and ready to spring into action, or you can be ignorant and die with your head in the sand. It's your choice.
OldSarge

Assuredly, a very high state of being constantly afraid.

 
 Oh joy another drive by with absolutely no proof or evidence.
Superlite27

Right. Also, if you own a fire extinguisher you are a paranoid wuss living in constant fear of your house burning to the ground.

 
 Also, don't forget that if you wear your seatbelt, you're a worrywart in constant fear of having a car wreck.
 
 There's a medicine cabinet in my bathroom.
 
 I guess this means I live in constant fear of getting sick.
 
 There is a package of band-aids in there, I must be living in constant fear of bleeding to death.
 
 I took swimming lessons as a kid.
 
 I must be living in constant fear of drowning right here at my computer desk.
 
 
 You know, the more I think about it, the more I realize that there are two categories of murder victims: Those who died with a legally carried weapon in their posession and those who died unarmed.
 
 Oh, wait. Nevermind. I can't seem to find any articles about legally armed people getting murdered. It seems that the majority of folks are killed when they are unarmed.
 
 Hmmmmmmm. Seems to me, all the dead people aren't legally carrying guns. 
 
 Now why should I live in fear?
 
 I'm not in the category containing all the dead people.
COBHC

Soon enough the government will want our guns. Every dictatorship in the past has taken guns, and it really looks like the lefties don't like democracy. They like to decide what they think is best for the people. That's why there's so many Czars, that's why they're passing this healthcare plan when hardly anyone likes it.
